intro: Senecio quitensis, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Senecio quitensis has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often used in traditional medicine by local communities for its purported health benefits.
